definition: mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
to hand over/to deliver/to pay (money)/to turn over/to make friends/to intersect (lines)/variant of 跤[jiao1]
to clench one's teeth/to grind the teeth/gnaw
gnashing one's teeth (idiom); displaying extreme anger/fuming with rage between gritted teeth
to arbitrarily assert/to allege/to stick to one's statement/to cling to one's view
lit. to bite the teeth tightly (idiom); fig. to grit one's teeth and bear the pain/to bite the bullet
(of uneven surfaces) to fit together/(of gear wheels) to mesh/(dentistry) occlusion/bite
to bite words and chew characters (idiom); punctilious about minutiae of wording
to chew/to masticate/to ruminate/to mull over
see 咬緊牙關|咬紧牙关[yao3 jin3 ya2 guan1]

sentences.english: But, if a man bites a dog, that might make front-page news.
sentences.chinese: 但是，如果人咬了狗，那倒可能成为头版新闻。

sentences.english: Bite valve cover protects from dirt and debris, includes a bite valve inside.
sentences.chinese: 咬合阀盖保护阀远离灰尘和碎片，包括内置咬气门芯。

sentences.english: The wildcat intruded into Chenggong's territory and was caught and killed by her.
sentences.chinese: 据悉，该野猫私闯了“成功”的领地，被抓捕并咬死。

sentences.english: I really admire your courage in biting your toe nail in public.
sentences.chinese: 我真信服你敢于在平易近众场所咬脚趾甲的勇气。

sentences.english: It is rude to cut your bread or bite from it.
sentences.chinese: 用刀切或直接咬都是不礼貌的。

sentences.english: The dog has nipped the postmen on the leg.
sentences.chinese: 这条狗咬了邮递员的腿。

sentences.english: The gums bleed whenever I bite into an apple or something like that.
sentences.chinese: 每次我咬苹果或其他类似东西时牙床会流血。

sentences.english: Dogs that bark at a distance never bite.
Fatso took offense to this, spun around and bit the 36-year-old man on his right leg.
sentences.chinese: 胖子采取攻击并且转身咬了这位36岁男子的右腿。

sentences.english: When Larkshimi tried to killed the chital, she has to avoid the sharp buckhorn which will be very dangerous to the tiger.
sentences.chinese: 当老虎试图咬死白斑鹿的时候，就要避开锋利的鹿角。

sentences.english: How do I know she won't kick, or bite at my crotch?
sentences.chinese: 我如何确知她不会乱踢乱踹，或咬我的裤裆？

sentences.english: The tooth hurts only when he bites down on it.
I'm fishing. The fish is biting.
I tell you that one stork dropped the little tyke off in a diaper.
sentences.chinese: 我告诉你他是一只鹳咬着尿布扔下来的。

sentences.english: Like they say, barking dogs don't bite.
sentences.chinese: 常言说的好，会叫的狗不咬人。

sentences.english: Within minutes of being bitten, Bamboo's Father dropped dead!
sentences.chinese: 被咬后几分钟内，竹蛇之父倒地而死。

definition: readily/flatly (deny, admit and so on)/a mouthful/a bite
tongue/CL:個|个[ge4]/enemy soldier captured for the purpose of extracting information
big mouthful (of food, drink, smoke etc)/open mouth/gulping/gobbling/gaping
to clench one's teeth/to grind the teeth/gnaw
mouth/CL:張|张[zhang1]/slap in the face/CL:個|个[ge4]
to open one's mouth (to speak, esp. to make a request)/to gape
to pinch (with one's fingers)/to knead/to make up
